default: (a) a {@item greataxe|phb} or (b) any {@filter martial melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;melee weapon=sand}
(a) two {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
An {@item explorer's pack|phb}, and four {@item javelin|phb|javelins}

subclass.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
subclassFeatures: Path of the Ancestral Guardian|Barbarian|Ishiir|Ancestral Guardian|Ishiir|3

subclass.name: Path of the Raging Serpent
subclassFeatures: Path of the Raging Serpent|Barbarian|Ishiir|Raging Serpent|Ishiir|3
Wrath of the Raging Serpent|Barbarian|Ishiir|Raging Serpent|Ishiir|14

subclass.name: Path of the Storm Herald
subclassFeatures: Path of the Storm Herald|Barbarian|Ishiir|Storm Herald|Ishiir|3

subclass.name: Path of the Wild Heart
subclassFeatures: Path of the Wild Heart|Barbarian|Ishiir|Wild Heart|Ishiir|3

subclass.name: Path of the World Tree
subclassFeatures: Path of the World Tree|Barbarian|Ishiir|World Tree|Ishiir|3

classFeature.name: Rage
entries: You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} if you aren't wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

entries.name: Rage Damage
entries: When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir}—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

entries.name: Strength Advantage
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

entries.name: No Concentration or Spells
entries: You can't maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}, and you can't cast spells.

entries.name: Duration
entries: The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

items: Make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against an enemy.
Force an enemy to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.
Take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to extend your Rage.

entries: Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Danger Sense
entries: You gain an uncanny sense of when things aren't as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge perils. You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} unless you have the {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} condition.

classFeature.name: Reckless Attack
entries: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with increased ferocity. When you make your first {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} using Strength until the start of your next turn, but {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} during that time.

classFeature.name: Survival Instincts
entries: {@i 2nd-level barbarian feature (replaces Danger Sense)}

You become {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in your choice of two of the following skills: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}.
Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} you make that uses either of those skills.

classFeature.name: Primal Knowledge
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in another skill of your choice from the skill list available to Barbarians at level 1.

In addition, while your Rage is active, you can channel primal power when you attempt certain tasks; whenever you make an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Strength check even if it normally uses a different ability: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}. When you use this ability, your Strength represents primal power coursing through you, honing your agility, bearing, and senses.

classFeature.name: Primal Path
entries: You choose a path that shapes the nature of your rage from the list of available paths. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th levels.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Martial Mastery
entries: You gain the mastery benefits for two {@filter weapons|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;!light;!medium;!heavy} of your choice as well as an {@filter armor|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;light;medium;heavy} type (see {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Weapon Mastery|Ishiir} variant rules). You must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in the chosen weapons and armor. If you possess the {@optfeature Unarmored Defense|Ishiir} feature, you may choose it in place of an armor type.
You can change your choices when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Fast Movement
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing heavy armor.

classFeature.name: Path Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Primal Path.

classFeature.name: Feral Instinct
entries: Your instincts are so honed that you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on initiative rolls.

Additionally, if you are {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} at the beginning of combat and aren't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, you can act normally on your first turn, but only if you enter your rage before doing anything else on that turn.

classFeature.name: Instinctive Pounce
entries: As part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} you take to enter your rage, you can move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Brutal Strike
entries: If you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo any {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on one Strength-based {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} of your choice on your turn. The chosen {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} mustn't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}. If the chosen {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} hits, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir}, and you can cause one Brutal Strike effect of your choice. You have the following effect options.

items.name: Forceful Blow.
items.entry: The target must succeed on a STR {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be pushed 15 feet straight away from you. You can then move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} straight toward the target without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

items.name: Hamstring Blow.
items.entry: The target must succeed on a DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or have its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn. A target can be affected by only one Hamstring Blow at a time—the most recent one.

classFeature.name: Path Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Primal Path.

classFeature.name: Overwhelming Might
entries: The size of your weapon's damage die increases by 2 steps.

classFeature.name: Relentless Rage
entries: Your Rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 Hit Points while your Rage is active and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If you succeed, your Hit Points instead change to a number equal to twice your Barbarian level.
Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, the DC resets to 10.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Improved Brutal Strike
entries: You have honed new ways to attack furiously. The following effects are now among your Brutal Strike options.

items.name: Staggering Blow.
items.entry: The target must succeed on a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the next {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} it makes, and it can't take {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions} until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Sundering Blow.
items.entry: Before the start of your next turn, the next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} made by another creature against the target gains a +5 bonus to the roll. An {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} can gain only one Sundering Blow bonus.

classFeature.name: Path Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Primal Path.

classFeature.name: Persistent Rage
entries: When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended uses of Rage. After you regain uses of Rage in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

In addition, your Rage is so fierce that it now lasts for 10 minutes without you needing to do anything to extend it from round to round. Your Rage ends early if you have the {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir} condition (not just the Incapacitated condition) or don Heavy armor.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Improved Brutal Strike
entries: The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to {@damage 2d10}. In addition, you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.

classFeature.name: Indomitable Might
entries: If your total for a Strength check or Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Primal Champion
entries: You embody the power of the wilds. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
entries: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. These tribes teach that the warriors of the past linger in the world as mighty spirits, who can guide and protect the living. When a barbarian who follows this path rages, the barbarian contacts the spirit world and calls on these guardian spirits for aid.

Barbarians who draw on their ancestral guardians can better fight to protect their tribes and their allies. In order to cement ties to their ancestral guardians, barbarians who follow this path cover themselves in elaborate tattoos that celebrate their ancestors' deeds. These tattoos tell sagas of victories against terrible monsters and other fearsome rivals.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Spectral warriors appear when you enter your rage. While you're raging, the first creature you hit with an attack on your turn becomes the target of the warriors, which hinder its attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on any {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} that isn't against you, and when the target hits a creature other than you with an attack, that creature has {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to the damage dealt by the attack. The effect on the target ends early if your rage ends.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Shield
entries: The guardian spirits that aid you can provide supernatural protection to those you defend. If you are raging and another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to reduce that damage by {@dice 2d6}.
When you reach certain levels in this class, you can reduce the damage by more: by {@dice 3d6} at 10th level and by {@dice 4d6} at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: You gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits. When you do so, you cast the {@spell augury|Ishiir} or {@spell clairvoyance|Ishiir} spell, without using a spell slot or material components. Rather than creating a spherical sensor, this use of {@spell clairvoyance|Ishiir} invisibly summons one of your ancestral spirits to the chosen location. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
After you cast either spell in this way, you can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: Your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to retaliate. When you use your Spirit Shield to reduce the damage of an attack, the attacker takes an amount of force damage equal to the damage that your Spirit Shield prevents.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Battlerager
entries: Known as Kuldjargh (literally "axe idiot") in Dwarvish, battleragers are dwarf followers of the gods of war and take the Path of the Battlerager. They specialize in wearing bulky, spiked armor and throwing themselves into combat, striking with their body itself and giving themselves over to the fury of battle.

subclassFeature.name: Battlerager Armor
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in heavy armor and ignore all restrictions for Barbarian class features while wearing heavy armor. You also gain the ability to modify your armor with spikes, blades, and other hazardous materials and turn it into a weapon: spiked armor.
Every time you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, you can use this feature to remove these materials from your current spiked armor and attach them to another armor of your choice.

Spiked armor has the same properties as the original armor. Additionally, it counts as a heavy martial melee weapon with a reach of 5 ft that you are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d4} piercing damage. You use your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls. If spiked your armor has a permanent bonus to its armor class (e.g. the masterwork property), you add this bonus to your attack and damage rolls with it.
When you are raging and wearing spiked armor, you can make one attack with your spiked armor as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

Additionally, when you successfully {@action grapple|Ishiir} a creature or {@action shove|Ishiir} it {@condition Prone|Ishiir}, the creature also takes damage equal to your Strength modifier. If you are raging, you add your rage damage bonus to this damage.

subclassFeature.name: Restriction—Dwarves Only
entries: Only dwarves can follow the Path of the Battlerager. The battlerager fills a particular niche in dwarven society and culture.
Your DM can lift this restriction to better suit the campaign. The restriction exists for the Forgotten Realms. It might not apply to your DM's setting or your DM's version of the Realms.

subclassFeature.name: Spiked Retribution
entries: When you are wearing spiked armor and a creature touches you (e.g. by grappling you or hitting you with a natural weapon attack) or hits you with a melee attack from within 5 ft, it takes piercing damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. If your armor has a permanent bonus to its armor class (e.g. the masterwork property), you add this bonus to the damage.

subclassFeature.name: Battlerager Charge
entries: You can take the {@action Dash|Ishiir} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} while you are raging.

subclassFeature.name: Armored Hulk
entries: When you enter a rage, you gain the temporary hit points from your armor mastery again, which stack with any existing temporary hit points from that feature. These temporary hit points last until your rage ends.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Beast
entries: Barbarians who walk the Path of the Beast draw their rage from a bestial spark burning within their souls. That beast bursts forth in the throes of rage, physically transforming the barbarian.
Such a barbarian might be inhabited by a primal spirit or be descended from shape-shifters. You can choose the origin of your feral might or determine it by rolling on the Origin of the Beast table.

entries.caption: Origin of the Beast
rows: One of your parents is a lycanthrope, and you've inherited some of their curse.
You are descended from an archdruid and inherited the ability to partially change shape.
A fey spirit gifted you with the ability to adopt different bestial aspects.
An ancient animal spirit dwells within you, allowing you to walk this path.

subclassFeature.name: Form of the Beast
entries: Your bestial spark manifests in the form of natural weapons.

Choose one of the following options: bite, claws, horns, hooves, pincers, or tail. You permanently gain the selected option as a natural weapon. It deals {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit. You can choose whether it deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage when you select it. It counts as a simple weapon for you and you use your Strength modifier for attack and damage rolls with it.
You can choose how the natural weapon looks exactly. For example, the bite option might give you long fangs, mandibles, or even a beak.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Fury
entries: When you enter your rage, the influence of your bestial spark on your form intensifies. You gain the listed benefit for your natural weapon for the duration of your rage. This effect only applies to attacks with your chosen natural weapon.

entries.name: Bite
entries: When you damage a creature, you regain hitpoints equal to half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} (rounded up). This amount is doubled against creatures that have half or less of their maximum hitpoints and tripled if you reduce it to 0 hitpoints.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Once on each of your turns when you attack a creature, you can immediately make another attack.

entries.name: Horns
entries: Your critical range increases by 1. On your turn, when you move towards a creature in a straight line for the first time, you can add 1 damage for every 5 ft spent as part of that movement to the first melee weapon damage roll you make against that creature.

entries.name: Hooves
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size larger than you, you can attempt to {@action shove|Ishiir} the target as part of this attack. Attacks against {@condition Prone|Ishiir} creatures deal additional damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Pincers
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size larger than you, you can attempt to {@action grapple|Ishiir} the target as part of this attack. Creatures {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} by you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}.

entries.name: Tail
entries: Your reach increases by 5 feet and when an enemy provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can make the attack without spending a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, but you cannot make another opportunity attack until the start of your next turn.

If a creature you can see within your reach hits you with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to add your Strength modifier to your AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Soul
entries: The feral power within you increases, causing the natural weapons of your Form of the Beast to count as magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks and damage.

You can also alter your form to help you adapt to your surroundings. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you finish your next {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}:

items: You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and you can breathe underwater.

You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}.
When you jump, you can make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check and extend your jump by a number of feet equal to the check's total. You can make this special check only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Fury
entries: When you hit a creature with your natural weapons while you are raging, the beast within you can curse your target with rabid fury. The target must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus) or suffer one of the following effects (your choice):

items: The target must use its {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make a melee attack against another creature of your choice that you can see.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Call the Hunt
entries: The beast within you grows so powerful that you can spread its ferocity to others and gain resilience from them joining your hunt. When you enter your rage, you can choose a number of other willing creatures you can see within 30 feet of you equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one creature).

You gain 5 temporary hit points for each creature that accepts this feature. Until the rage ends, the chosen creatures can each use the following benefit once on each of their turns: when the creature hits a target with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} and deals damage to it, the creature can roll a {@dice d6} and gain a bonus to the damage equal to the number rolled.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Berserker
entries: For some barbarians, rage is a means to an end—that end being violence. The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker's rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzy
entries: While you are raging, you can make one additional attack as part of your Attack action when you are using your Reckless attack class feature.

subclassFeature.name: Mindless Rage
entries: You can't be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} while raging. If you are {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} when you enter your rage, the effect ends.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: When you enter a frenzy, you also adopt a menacing presence that frightens foes around you. Any hostile creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of you while you are in a frenzy or enters that area for the first time on a turn and can see or hear you, must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC equal to 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Strength modifier) or be {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you until the start of its next turn.
If a creature's {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} is successful, it is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to your Intimidating Presence for the next 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Retaliation
entries: When you take damage from a creature that is within reach of your equipped melee weapon, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Giant
entries: Barbarians who walk the Path of the Giant draw strength from the primal forces that are the Giants and their elemental ilk. Their rages surge with elemental power and cause these barbarians to grow in size, transforming them into avatars of primordial might.

During their rage, a barbarian may take after a legendary storm giant, hair turning white and eyes crackling with lightning. Others adopt the monstrous features of apocalyptic titans, rending the world around them so that it may be made anew.

subclassFeature.name: Giant Power
entries: When you choose this path, you learn to speak, read, and write Giant or one other language of your choice if you already know Giant. Additionally, you learn either the {@spell druidcraft|Ishiir} or {@spell thaumaturgy|Ishiir} cantrip (your choice). Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

You are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with ranged weapon attacks you make with improvised weapons. When you make a ranged weapon attack with an improvised weapon or a thrown weapon, you do not suffer {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} for attacking at long range with either.

subclassFeature.name: Giant's Havoc
entries: Your rages pull strength from the primal might of giants, transforming you into a hulking force of destruction. While raging, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Crushing Hurl
entries: When you make a ranged weapon attack with a thrown weapon or an improvised weapon, you double your rage damage bonus to the attack's damage.

items.name: Giant Stature
entries: Your reach increases by 5 feet, and if you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If there isn't enough room for you to become Large, your size doesn't change.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Cleaver
entries: Your bond with the elemental might of giants and their ilk grows, and you learn to infuse weapons with primordial energy.

When you enter your rage, you can infuse one weapon of your choice that you are holding with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, thunder, or lightning. While you wield the infused weapon during your rage, the weapon's damage type changes to the chosen type, it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the chosen type when it hits, and it gains the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If you throw the weapon, it reappears in your hand the instant after it hits or misses a target. The infused weapon's benefits are suppressed while a creature other than you wields it.
While raging and holding the infused weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to change the infused weapon's current damage type to a different one from the above damage types.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Impel
entries: Your connection to giant strength now allows you to hurl both allies and enemies on the battlefield. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} while raging, you can choose one Medium or smaller creature within your reach and move it to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of yourself. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC equals 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Strength modifier) to avoid the effect.
If, at the end of this movement, the thrown creature isn't on a surface or liquid that can support it, the creature falls, taking damage as normal and landing {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Demiurgic Colossus
entries: The primordial power of your rage intensifies. When you rage, your reach now increases by 10 feet, your size can increase to Huge, and you can now use your Mighty Impel to move creatures that are Large or smaller.
In addition, the extra damage dealt by your Elemental Cleaver feature increases to {@dice 2d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Raging Serpent
entries: Among the barbarians whose fury is inspired by their divine patron, none are more feared than the Fangs of the Raging Serpent. Heralds of Gargan's wrath, they punish heretics and those who have, in particular, drawn the eye of the ocean god. Tattooing their bodies in tribute to him, the Fangs emulate their patron in many ways, adopting his dualistic nature: calm as the still sea one moment and violent and undeniable as the storm tide the next.

Those with a particularly profound connection to their patron even exhibit some physical changes when they enter their rage, such as serpent-like eyes of startling blue, a constant sheen of water on their skin, or small arcs of electricity dancing across their bodies.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Waves
entries: You no longer have need for weapons. You learn to throw your weight around with the might of the waves and your hands become instruments of Gargan's will - and with that, his crushing, inescapable grasp. You can roll a {@dice d8} in place of the normal damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir}. If you have both hands free or are attacking a target that you have grappled, this die changes to a {@dice d12}.

Additionally, you gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. If you already have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir}, that {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} instead increases by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Coils
entries: Spectral coils start appearing around you when you enter your rage. While you are raging, your reach with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} increases by 5 ft and you ignore all size restrictions and immunities for attempting grapples.
Once per turn, if you successfully hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir} while raging, you can attempt to grapple it.

You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to force a creature you grappled in this manner to make a STR {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The DC is equal to 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your STR modifier. On a failure, the creature takes force damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your STR modifier + your rage bonus damage and is {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Serpent
entries: Your connection to Gargan deepens, causing your unarmed attacks to count as magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks and damage.
Additionally, you gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Calm before the Storm
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Raging Serpent
entries: While you are raging you can call down your god's fury in the form of a powerful lightning bolt when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack. The target has to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The DC is equal to 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your STR modifier. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 12d10} lightning damage, and half as much on a successful one. Any creature that you have grappled has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.
You cannot use this feature again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend a use of your rage to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Storm Herald
entries: All barbarians harbor a fury within. Their rage grants them superior strength, durability, and speed. Barbarians who follow the Path of the Storm Herald learn to transform that rage into a mantle of primal magic, which swirls around them. When in a fury, a barbarian of this path taps into the forces of nature to create powerful magical effects.

Storm heralds are typically elite champions who train alongside druids, rangers, and others sworn to protect nature. Other storm heralds hone their craft in lodges in regions wracked by storms, in the frozen reaches at the world's end, or deep in the hottest deserts.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Aura
entries: You emanate a stormy, magical aura while you rage. The aura extends 10 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover.
Your aura has an effect that is active for the duration of your rage, and an additional empowered effect.
You can empower your aura only once per rage.

Choose blaze, thunderstorm, or blizzard. Your aura's effect depends on your choice, as detailed below. You can change this choice whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
If your aura's effects require a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, the DC equals 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Blaze
entries: When a creature touches you, or hits you with a melee attack from within your aura, it takes fire damage equal to {@damage 1d4} x half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} (rounded down). When you empower this aura as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, all creatures in your aura have to make a DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. A creature takes fire damage equal to {@damage 1d6} x your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} on a failure, or half as much on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderstorm
entries: On your turn, choose a creature that is in your aura. That creature has to make DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, the target takes lightning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} x your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, or half as much on a success. When you empower this aura as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can teleport up to 60 ft to an unoccupied space that you can see. If you do so, you double the next instance of this aura's damage during this rage.

subclassFeature.name: Blizzard
entries: When you enter your rage, you gain temporary hit points equal to 5 x your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}. When you empower this aura as a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, you gain a bonus to your AC and DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Soul
entries: The storm grants you benefits even when your aura isn't active. The benefits are based on the environment you chose for your Storm Aura.

subclassFeature.name: Blaze
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage, and you don't suffer the effects of extreme heat, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide. Moreover, as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried by anyone else and set it on fire.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderstorm
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to lightning damage, and you can breathe underwater. You also gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Blizzard
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage, and you don't suffer the effects of extreme cold, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide. Moreover, as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch water and turn a 5-foot cube of it into ice, which melts after 1 minute. This action fails if a creature is in the cube.

subclassFeature.name: Shielding Storm
entries: You learn to use your mastery of the storm to protect others. Each creature of your choice has the damage {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} you gained from the Storm Soul feature while the creature is in your Storm Aura.

subclassFeature.name: Raging Storm
entries: The power of the storm you channel grows mightier, lashing out at your foes. The radius of your aura grows to 20 ft and your aura gains an additional effect.

subclassFeature.name: Blaze
entries: When a creature triggers this aura's effect, you can deal the same damage to one other creature of your choice within your aura.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderstorm
entries: You can choose to target up to two creatures with this aura's effect.

subclassFeature.name: Blizzard
entries: During your turn, you can choose one creature you can see in the aura. That creature must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn, as magical frost covers it.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Wild Heart
entries: The Path of the Wild Heart is a spiritual journey, as the barbarian accepts a spirit animal as guide, protector, and inspiration. In battle, your totem spirit fills you with supernatural might, adding magical fuel to your barbarian rage.
Most barbarian tribes consider a totem animal to be kin to a particular clan. In such cases, it is unusual for an individual to have more than one totem animal spirit, though exceptions exist.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Speaker
entries: At 3rd level when you adopt this path, you can cast the {@spell beast sense|Ishiir} and {@spell speak with animals|Ishiir} spells, but only as rituals. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them.

subclassFeature.name: Rage of the Wilds
entries: Your Rage taps into the primal power of animals. Whenever you activate your Rage, you gain one of the following options of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Bear
entries: While your Rage is active, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to every damage type except Force, Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant.

subclassFeature.name: Eagle
entries: When you activate your Rage, you can take the {@action Disengage|Ishiir} and {@action Dash|Ishiir} actions as part of that {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. While your Rage is active, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to take both of those actions.

subclassFeature.name: Tiger
entries: When you deal piercing or slashing damage to a creature, you can force it to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The DC equals 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your STR modifier. On a failure, the target is {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir}. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on a success. The spirit of the tiger empowers your ferocity.

subclassFeature.name: Wolf
entries: While your Rage is active, your allies have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against any enemy of yours within 10 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Elk
entries: While you're raging and aren't wearing heavy armor, your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 15 feet. The spirit of the elk makes you extraordinarily swift.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of the Wilds
entries: You gain a magical benefit based on the totem animal of your choice. You can choose the same animal you selected at 3rd level or a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Bear
entries: You gain the might of a bear. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift as well as for grappling or shoving a creature.

subclassFeature.name: Eagle
entries: You gain the eyesight of an eagle. You can see up to 1 mile away with no difficulty, able to discern even fine details as though looking at something no more than 100 feet away from you. Long range no longer imposes {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on your ranged weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Elk
entries: Whether mounted or on foot, your travel pace is doubled, as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they're within 60 feet of you and you're not {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. The elk spirit helps you roam far and fast.

subclassFeature.name: Tiger
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in two skills from the following list: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Survival}. The cat spirit hones your survival instincts.

subclassFeature.name: Owl
entries: You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Panther
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. Your long jump distance increases 30 ft and your high jump distance to 15 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Salmon
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} and you can breathe underwater.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Walker
entries: You can cast the {@spell commune with nature|Ishiir} spell, but only as a ritual. When you do so, a spiritual version of one of the animals you chose for Totem Spirit or Aspect of the Beast appears to you to convey the information you seek.

subclassFeature.name: Power of the Wilds
entries: You gain a magical benefit based on a totem animal of your choice. You can choose the same animal you selected previously or a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Bear
entries: While you're raging, any creature within 5 feet of you that's hostile to you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against targets other than you or another character with this feature. An enemy is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to this effect if it can't see or hear you.

subclassFeature.name: Eagle
entries: While raging, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your current {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. This benefit works only in short bursts; you fall if you end your turn in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft.

subclassFeature.name: Wolf
entries: If you are raging and hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can force it to make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC equal to 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Elk
entries: While raging, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} during your move to pass through the space of a Large or smaller creature. That creature must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC 8 + your Strength bonus + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus) or be knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir} and take bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d12} + your Strength modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Tiger
entries: While you're raging, if you move at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a Large or smaller target right before making a melee weapon attack against it, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to make an additional melee weapon attack against it.

subclassFeature.name: Falcon
entries: While your Rage is active, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} if you aren't wearing any armor.

subclassFeature.name: Lion
entries: While your Rage is active, any of your enemies within 5 feet of you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against targets other than you or another Barbarian who has this option active.

subclassFeature.name: Path of Wild Magic
entries: Many places in the multiverse abound with beauty, intense emotion, and rampant magic; the Feywild, the Upper Planes, and other realms of supernatural power radiate with such forces and can profoundly influence people. As folk of deep feeling, barbarians are especially susceptible to these wild influences, with some barbarians being transformed by the magic. These magic-suffused barbarians walk the Path of Wild Magic. Elf, tiefling, aasimar, and genasi barbarians often seek this path, eager to manifest the otherworldly magic of their ancestors.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Awareness
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can open your awareness to the presence of concentrated magic. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any spell or magic item within 60 feet of you that isn't behind total cover. When you sense a spell, you learn which school of magic it belongs to.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Surge
entries: The magical energy roiling inside you sometimes erupts from you. When you enter your rage, roll on the Wild Magic table to determine the magical effect produced.
If the effect requires a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, the DC equals 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Constitution modifier.

entries.caption: Wild Magic
rows: Shadowy tendrils lash around you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage. You also gain {@dice 1d12} temporary hit points.
You teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

An intangible spirit, which looks like a {@creature flumph} or a {@creature pixie} (your choice), appears within 5 feet of one creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. At the end of the current turn, the spirit explodes, and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 1d6} force damage. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again, summoning another spirit, on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

Magic infuses one weapon of your choice that you are holding. Until your rage ends, the weapon's damage type changes to force, and it gains the light and thrown properties, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If the weapon leaves your hand, the weapon reappears in your hand at the end of the current turn.
Whenever a creature hits you with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} before your rage ends, that creature takes {@damage 1d6} force damage, as magic lashes out in retribution.
Until your rage ends, you are surrounded by multi colored, protective lights; you gain a +1 bonus to AC, and while within 10 feet of you, your allies gain the same bonus.
Flowers and vines temporarily grow around you. Until your rage ends, the ground within 15 feet of you is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for your enemies.

A bolt of light shoots from your chest. Another creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take {@damage 1d6} radiant damage and be {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the start of your next turn. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstering Magic
entries: You can harness your wild magic to bolster yourself or a companion. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch one creature (which can be yourself) and confer one of the following benefits of your choice to that creature:

items: For 10 minutes, the creature can roll a {@dice d3} whenever making an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} or an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} roll.

Roll a {@dice d3}. The creature regains one expended spell slot, the level of which equals the number rolled or lower (the creature's choice). Once a creature receives this benefit, that creature can't receive it again until after a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries: You can take this action a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Unstable Backlash
entries: When you are imperiled during your rage, the magic within you can lash out; immediately after you take damage or fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} while raging, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to roll on the Wild Magic table and immediately produce the effect rolled. This effect replaces your current Wild Magic effect.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Surge
entries: Whenever you roll on the Wild Magic table, you can roll the die twice and choose which of the two effects to unleash. If you roll the same number on both dice, you can ignore the number and choose any effect on the table.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the World Tree
entries: Barbarians who follow the Path of the World Tree believe that their Rage links them to the cosmic ash tree Yggdrasil. This “world tree” grows among the Outer Planes, connecting them to each other and to the many worlds of the Material Plane, and the greatest plants on every world are said to be distant descendants of mighty Yggdrasil. These Barbarians draw on their connection to the world tree as a source of vitality and as a means of travel across the multiverse

entries.subclassFeature: Vitality of the World Tree|Barbarian|Ishiir|World Tree|Ishiir|3

subclassFeature.name: Vitality of the World Tree
entries: When you activate your Rage, you regain a number of Hit Points equal to your Barbarian level. At the start of each of your turns while your Rage is active, you regain hitpoints equal to half your barbarian level (rounded down) and you can choose another creature within 10 feet of yourself to gain Temporary Hit Points. To determine the number of Temporary Hit Points, roll a number of d6s equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, and add them together. If any of these Temporary Hit Points remain when your Rage ends, they vanish.

subclassFeature.name: Branches of the Tree
entries: Whenever a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you while your Rage is active, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to summon spectral branches of the World Tree around it. The target must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} Bonus) or be teleported to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of yourself or in the nearest unoccupied space you can see. After the target teleports, you can reduce its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} to 0 until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Battering Roots
entries: Tendrils of the World Tree extend from your melee weapons. While you wield any melee weapon, your reach with that weapon increases by 10 feet.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack while raging, you can use the {@action Shove|Ishiir} action against that same creature. You can count as Huge for the purpose of this {@action Shove|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Travel Along the Tree
entries: When you activate your Rage and as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} while your Rage is active, you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

In addition, once per Rage, you can increase the range of that teleport to 150 feet. When you do so, you can also bring up to six willing creatures who are within 10 feet of you. Each creature teleports to an unoccupied space of your choice within 10 feet of your destination space.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Zealot
entries: Some deities inspire their followers to pitch themselves into a ferocious battle fury. These barbarians are zealots—warriors who channel their rage into powerful displays of divine power.

A variety of gods across the worlds of D&D inspire their followers to embrace this path. Tempus from the Forgotten Realms and Hextor and Erythnul of Greyhawk are all prime examples. In general, the gods who inspire zealots are deities of combat, destruction, and violence. Not all are evil, but few are good.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Fury
entries: You can channel divine fury into your weapon strikes. While you're raging, the first creature you hit on each of your turns with a weapon attack takes extra damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + half your barbarian level. The extra damage is necrotic or radiant; you choose the type of damage each time damage is dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Gods
entries: A divine entity helps ensure you can continue the fight. You have a pool of four d12s that you can spend to heal yourself. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend dice from the pool, roll them, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll's total.
Your pool regains one die when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, and all expended dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
The pool's maximum number of dice increases by one when you reach Barbarian levels 6 (5 dice), 12 (6 dice), and 17 (7 dice).

subclassFeature.name: Fanatical Focus
entries: The divine power that fuels your rage can protect you. If you fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} while you're raging, you can reroll it and take the highest. You can use this ability only once per rage.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Presence
entries: You learn to channel divine power to inspire zealotry in others. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you unleash a battle cry infused with divine energy. Up to ten other creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you that can hear you gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} until the start of your next turn.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. If you’ve run out of uses of this feature, you can expend one use of your Rage, choosing to activate this feature instead of Rage.

subclassFeature.name: Rage of the Gods
entries: When you activate your Rage, you can assume the form of a divine warrior. This form lasts for 1 minute or until you drop to 0 Hit Points. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
While in this form, you gain the benefits below.

items.name: Flight.
items.entry: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} and can hover.

items.name: Resistance.
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage.

items.name: Revivification.
items.entry: When a creature within 30 feet of you would drop to 0 Hit Points, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend a use of your Rage to instead change the target's Hit Points to a number equal to your Barbarian level.
